message: I'm attempting to setup celery with redis, running into a configuration problem - details here: http://dpaste.de/9dTe/ . It appears to be a kombu/pyredis issue. Any ideas?
Also, the FAQ states "Redis/database also use polling, so they are likely to consume more resources." Is this still true? Is there a good reason to use polling when blocking pop calls are available?
use latest celery (2.2.7) and latest kombu (2.1.0) with latest redis-py
the kombu redis support doesn't actually use polling anymore, guess the faq needs to be updated
Thanks @asksol, got the basics working, looking forward to moving a bunch of custom async stuff over to celery
On the configuration problem: turned out to be fixed by updating to a newer version of the python redis library (from 2.2.4 to 2.4.5). Still interested in the polling question though.
